statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Richmond 71, East Carolina 67 (OT)
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Ryan Butler's 3-pointer with 1:12 remaining gave Richmond the lead in overtime and the Spiders held off East Carolina Tuesday night for a 71-67 win. Following Butler's basket, the Pirates' Courtney Captain hit two free throws to cut the margin to 66-65 with 35.8 seconds remaining. Richmond's Peter Thomas hit a layup, and Captain retaliated with two free throws with 15.8 seconds remaining. Brian Morris hit a pair of free throws, the Spiders forced Cory Farmer into a turnover and Jarhon Giddings hit one of two free throws with 3.8 seconds to seal the win. The Pirates (1-1) led by seven with 12:19 remaining. Richmond came back slowly, finally tying the game at 61 on Dan Geriot's 3-pointer with 2.6 seconds left. Over the final 9:01 of the second half and through the overtime period, the Pirates missed 13 of 15 field goal attempts. Thomas led the Spiders (1-0) with 16 points. Geriot added 14, Morris had 11 points with 10 rebounds and 8 assists, and Butler added 11 points. Captain led the Pirates with 22 points, Sam Hinnant added 13 and Gabe Blair 10 with 15 rebounds. East Carolina Coach Ricky Stokes is a Richmond native, a former Virginia Tech coach and Virginia star.
